item.title: Hello World
item.description: I’m worried that there aren’t enough websites. ðŸ–± A similar process is at work in how we access music and movies. In the not so distant past I would listen to music from a mountain of mp3 files on my hard drive, whereas now I stream it. In return for convenience, we don’t own media anymore: we rent it. Most people’s internet usage (including mine) is concentrated on a few websites, owned by private interests who are often bad stewards of the website they run.
